Davis says in neighborhoods with few job opportunities , some people are more likely to turn to crime , such as selling drugs , to earn quick cash .
It 's not an excuse , but it is a fact that given one 's social conditions , they turn to certain things for survival , Davis says .

He says minor traffic violations can be part of what causes some people to spiral downward .
